content: Declan I agree 100% with everything you have said. Great article and it’s refreshing to hear a talent acquisition leader focusing on the fundamentals, instead of résumé screening. We built a platform called Vervoe specifically to help employers with #3. We use the term automated interviews rather than work samples but they’re designed to achieve exactly the objective you stated: “… giving candidates a sample piece of work, similar to that which they would do in the job, and assessing their performance at it.” It’s the best indicator of future performance but it’s also an opportunity to see if candidates will love doing the tasks they’ll be doing on the job. No résumé will ever reveal that. I also agree that reference checking is an underrated and overlooked practice. You might be familiar with a book called Who: The A Method for Hiring by ghSMART. It outlines in great detail how to conduct reference checks for senior roles and those methods are applicable more broadly. Finally, I’m glad you called out the candidate experience. The term “honored guest” is a nice way of putting it. Really glad you wrote this article. Thanks, Omer
